carousel_items: Take 1 hour before a meal.
Don't chew or crush capsules; swallow them whole.
If you have trouble swallowing you can carefully open the capsules and sprinkle the inside pellets onto applesauce. Swallow the applesauce without chewing or crushing the pellets.
When using Nexium long-term, take a calcium citrate with vitamin D supplement daily to prevent bone loss. Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.
Get a blood test for your magnesium level once a year; you may need a magnesium supplement while using Nexium.
Avoid drug interactions by telling your doctor all of the other medications or herbal supplements you take before starting Nexium.

clock.tip: Take on an empty stomach before breakfast.

basics.benefits_moa: Nexium is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI). It lowers the amount of acid in your stomach, treats heartburn, and heals ulcers.
basics.bottom_line: Nexium gives you long-lasting heartburn relief. But this purple pill ain't cheap! The generic forms of alternative drugs work just as well, and are usually less expensive.
downsides: Doesn't start working as fast as some other antacids like Tums, Rolaids, or Maalox.
Like with other proton pump inhibitors, long-term use can cause weak or broken bones.
Can cause low levels of magnesium in the blood. You might need to take a magnesium supplement if you use Nexium long-term.
Can be expensive. Other alternatives are usually cheaper than Nexium.
Can interact with other drugs so be sure your doctor knows all the medicine you're taking before starting Nexium.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't start working as fast as some other antacids like Tums, Rolaids, or Maalox.
Like with other proton pump inhibitors, long-term use can cause weak or broken bones.
Can cause low levels of magnesium in the blood. You might need to take a magnesium supplement if you use Nexium long-term.
Can be expensive. Other alternatives are usually cheaper than Nexium.
Can interact with other drugs so be sure your doctor knows all the medicine you're taking before starting Nexium.

upsides: Most people can take Nexium without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Nexium lasts longer than other types of antacids (like Zantac, Pepcid, or Tums), and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
In studies it was better than a placebo (sugar pill) and as good as other proton pump inhibitors at treating heartburn.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.

upsides_processed.orig: Most people can take Nexium without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Nexium lasts longer than other types of antacids (like Zantac, Pepcid, or Tums), and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
In studies it was better than a placebo (sugar pill) and as good as other proton pump inhibitors at treating heartburn.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.

userStories.tip: Does cause me to feel tired, fatigued, kinda weak. Just no energy. Plus, I'm a little irritable. I have to take 40 mg to get full relief.
Been taking Nexium for 11 years and it's the only thing that works to calm my acid reflux.

I wish I had known how hard it would be to stop taking Nexium. I've been on it for six years and I am entirely dependent on it. My stomach just can't get used to having that much acid in it again. But I haven't had one bad day on Nexium!
userStories.identifier: Active, young adult, always on the go!

userStories.tip: Works better than any OTC meds.

drugs.name: Nexium

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take 1 hour before a meal.
Don't chew or crush capsules; swallow them whole.
If you have trouble swallowing you can carefully open the capsules and sprinkle the inside pellets onto applesauce. Swallow the applesauce without chewing or crushing the pellets.
When using Nexium long-term, take a calcium citrate with vitamin D supplement daily to prevent bone loss. Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.
Get a blood test for your magnesium level once a year; you may need a magnesium supplement while using Nexium.
Avoid drug interactions by telling your doctor all of the other medications or herbal supplements you take before starting Nexium.

risks_warnings.title: Hiding possible cancer
risks_warnings.description: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Nexium for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Nexium for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis)
risks_warnings.description: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis) has occasionally happened to people taking Nexium.  It can lead to digestion trouble, low vitamin B12 levels, and anemia. It's more common if you have a stomach infection caused by the bacteria Helicobacter pylori. If you need to take Nexium for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Severe stomach inflammation (atrophic gastritis) has occasionally happened to people taking Nexium.  It can lead to digestion trouble, low vitamin B12 levels, and anemia. It's more common if you have a stomach infection caused by the bacteria Helicobacter pylori. If you need to take Nexium for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Severe diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: Using medications like Nexium (proton pump inhibitors) can increase the chance of getting severe diarrhea.  This diarrhea is caused by an infection from a bacteria called clostridium difficle or C.Diff.  The infection is difficult to treat and can be life threatening. You are at a higher risk for C.Diff if you are currently or have recently been in a hospital.  You are also at higher risk if you are currently or have recently taken any antibiotic medication. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Nexium or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

description_processed.orig: Using medications like Nexium (proton pump inhibitors) can increase the chance of getting severe diarrhea.  This diarrhea is caused by an infection from a bacteria called clostridium difficle or C.Diff.  The infection is difficult to treat and can be life threatening. You are at a higher risk for C.Diff if you are currently or have recently been in a hospital.  You are also at higher risk if you are currently or have recently taken any antibiotic medication. If you develop significant diarrhea while taking Nexium or after stopping it, let you doctor know right away.

risks_warnings.title: Broken bones
risks_warnings.description: There is an increased risk of developing weakened bones (osteoporosis) and broken bones (fractures) while taking medications like Nexium (proton pump inhibitors).  It is believed that this happens because your stomach doesn't absorb calcium well while using this medication. Calcium is necessary for strong, healthy bones. In studies, people were more likely to get broken bones while using proton pump inhibitors when taking high doses and using them long-term (1 year or more). You are also at higher risk if you smoke or have other risk factors for osteoporosis.  The best way to prevent this side effect is to use the lowest dose of medication for the shortest period of time.  Taking a calcium supplement may or may not help prevent broken bones while using Nexium.  However, if you need to take Nexium long-term you should take a calcium supplement to be safe.  Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.
risk_factors: Use of other medications that weaken bones

description_processed.orig: There is an increased risk of developing weakened bones (osteoporosis) and broken bones (fractures) while taking medications like Nexium (proton pump inhibitors).  It is believed that this happens because your stomach doesn't absorb calcium well while using this medication. Calcium is necessary for strong, healthy bones. In studies, people were more likely to get broken bones while using proton pump inhibitors when taking high doses and using them long-term (1 year or more). You are also at higher risk if you smoke or have other risk factors for osteoporosis.  The best way to prevent this side effect is to use the lowest dose of medication for the shortest period of time.  Taking a calcium supplement may or may not help prevent broken bones while using Nexium.  However, if you need to take Nexium long-term you should take a calcium supplement to be safe.  Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.

risks_warnings.title: Low vitamin or mineral levels
risks_warnings.description: All proton pump inhibitor medications, including Nexium, can cause low levels of blood magnesium or vitamin B12. This can happen with as little as 3 months of use but more commonly occurs after you've been using Nexium for a year or more. Your doctor can do a blood test to see if you need to take a vitamin or mineral supplement.

description_processed.orig: All proton pump inhibitor medications, including Nexium, can cause low levels of blood magnesium or vitamin B12. This can happen with as little as 3 months of use but more commonly occurs after you've been using Nexium for a year or more. Your doctor can do a blood test to see if you need to take a vitamin or mineral supplement.

carousel_items: Take with or without food.
Swallow tablets whole; don't split, crush, or chew.
Take the oral suspension 30 minutes before a meal mixed only with applesauce or apple juice. Follow instructions carefully.

When using Pantoprazole long-term, take a calcium citrate with vitamin D supplement daily to prevent bone loss. Be sure it's calcium citrate because it works the best when using a proton pump inhibitor.
Get a blood test for your magnesium level once a year; you may need a magnesium supplement while using Pantoprazole.
Avoid drug interactions by telling your doctor all of the other medications or herbal supplements you take before starting Pantoprazole.

basics.benefits_moa: Pantoprazole is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI). It lowers the amount of acid in your stomach, treats heartburn, and heals ulcers.
basics.bottom_line: Pantoprazole gives you long-lasting heartburn relief. Choose the cheapest proton pump inhibitor because they all work equally well for heartburn.
downsides: Doesn't start working as fast as some other antacids like Tums, Rolaids, or Maalox.
Like with other proton pump inhibitors, long-term use can cause weak or broken bones.
Can cause low levels of magnesium in the blood. You might need to take a magnesium supplement if you use Pantoprazole long-term.
Can be expensive. Other alternatives are usually cheaper than Pantoprazole.
Less risk of drug interactions with Pantoprazole than with other proton pump inhibitors.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't start working as fast as some other antacids like Tums, Rolaids, or Maalox.
Like with other proton pump inhibitors, long-term use can cause weak or broken bones.
Can cause low levels of magnesium in the blood. You might need to take a magnesium supplement if you use Pantoprazole long-term.
Can be expensive. Other alternatives are usually cheaper than Pantoprazole.
Less risk of drug interactions with Pantoprazole than with other proton pump inhibitors.

upsides: Most people can take Pantoprazole without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Pantoprazole lasts longer than other types of antacids (like Zantac, Pepcid, or Tums), and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
In studies it was better than a placebo (sugar pill) and as good as other proton pump inhibitors at treating heartburn.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.

Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.

userStories.tip: Helped for a couple months, then I started getting acid reflux WAY worse than ever before. I stopped taking it and thankfully the acid reflux got better again. Would not recommend for extended amounts of time.
Pretty happy overall, works for me but if I stop taking it or any of the pump inhibitors Ive tried, symptoms return.
I have had huge relief from it. Will take for 6 to9 months until controlled
since it has to be taken 30 minutes before breakfast, it does interfere with morning routine.
symptoms return as soon as you stop

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: I felt like I had the flu, with nausea and diarrhea with muscle aches.  Symptoms got worse the longer I took the medicine.  I also became extremely lactose intolerant.  I was sensitive to lactose before but got to a point where I could not tolerate any dairy while taking this medicine.  Within a few days of stopping this medicine, my symptoms went away.

userStories.identifier: Been taking Protonix for over a decade.
userStories.tip: My doctor is concerned that long-term use of protonix by women has been connected to a higher risk of bone density loss and I am personally concerned about the risk of nutritional deficiencies.
had trouble getting 2xday covered by insurance, but sending in results of a gastroscopy did the trick

risks_warnings.title: Stomach cancer
risks_warnings.description: In animal studies, long-term use of Pantoprazole caused rare types of stomach tumors. Since acid-reflux disease (commonly known as heartburn) can last for a long time some people may find that they need to take Pantoprazole for a long time as well.  It is unknown if the risk for stomach tumors is the same for people as it is for other animals.

description_processed.orig: In animal studies, long-term use of Pantoprazole caused rare types of stomach tumors. Since acid-reflux disease (commonly known as heartburn) can last for a long time some people may find that they need to take Pantoprazole for a long time as well.  It is unknown if the risk for stomach tumors is the same for people as it is for other animals.

carousel_items: Take Prevacid about 1 hour before a meal.
Don't chew or crush capsules, but swallow them whole.
If you have trouble swallowing, there's a tablet available that dissolves in your mouth.
Give Prevacid a chance to work. You'll see some benefits right away, but the full effects can take a week or so to kick in.
Avoid drug interactions by telling your doctor all of the other medications or herbal supplements you take before starting Prevacid.

basics.benefits_moa: Prevacid is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI). It lowers the amount of acid in your stomach, treats heartburn, and heals ulcers.
basics.bottom_line: Prevacid gives you long-lasting heartburn relief and helps heal ulcers.
downsides: Doesn't start working as fast as some other antacids like Tums, Rolaids, or Maalox.
Depending on the condition you are treating, it can take one to two weeks to get the full effect.
If you are taking Prevacid for a long time you should take a calcium supplement to prevent fragile bones.
Can interact with other drugs, so be sure your doctor knows all the medicine you're taking before starting Prevacid.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't start working as fast as some other antacids like Tums, Rolaids, or Maalox.
Depending on the condition you are treating, it can take one to two weeks to get the full effect.
If you are taking Prevacid for a long time you should take a calcium supplement to prevent fragile bones.
Can interact with other drugs, so be sure your doctor knows all the medicine you're taking before starting Prevacid.

upsides: Most people can take Prevacid without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Prevacid lasts longer than other types of antacids (like Zantac, Pepcid, or Tums), and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.
Sometimes if one PPI doesn't work, another medication in the same class will work for you.

userStories.tip: take  2 times a day, once before  breakfast and once before dinner
take 2 times a day half hour  before meals
I take it before bed because presumably during the night is when small amounts of stomach acid can travel up my esophagus and damage my swallowing mechanism.
userStories.indication: GERD whose only symptom is choking when swallowing.

userStories.tip: If you take chronically, be sure to get Magnesium level tested. If you start to experience rapid heartbeat episodes, it is probably from low Magnesium related to long term proton pump inhibitor use.
userStories.indication: GERD diagnosed after swallowing problems noted

carousel_items: Works best if you take it with a full glass of water.
Starts working in one hour.
If heartburn doesn't improve or lasts more than 2 weeks, talk to your doctor.
People with kidney disease may need to take a lower dose.
Tell your doctor all of the medications that you use before taking Cimetidine to avoid drug interactions.

basics.benefits_moa: Cimetidine is a type of antacid called an H2 blocker. It blocks the chemical histamine, which lowers acid production in your stomach. This treats heartburn and helps ulcers heal.
basics.bottom_line: Cimetidine works well for heartburn but may not last as long or start working as quickly as other antacids.
downsides: Other antacids like Maalox, Tums, or Rolaids often start to work more quickly than Cimetidine.
Medication like omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) works better at healing and preventing stomach ulcers than medication like Cimetidine (H2 blockers).
Has more drug interactions than zantac and pepcid.

Although rare, Cimetidine can cause large breasts or impotence for men who need to use high doses for 6 months or more. It's reversible though and should go away when you stop or if you change medication.

downsides_processed.orig: Other antacids like Maalox, Tums, or Rolaids often start to work more quickly than Cimetidine.
Medication like omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) works better at healing and preventing stomach ulcers than medication like Cimetidine (H2 blockers).
Has more drug interactions than zantac and pepcid.

Although rare, Cimetidine can cause large breasts or impotence for men who need to use high doses for 6 months or more. It's reversible though and should go away when you stop or if you change medication.

upsides: Most people can take Cimetidine without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Cimetidine lasts longer than many other antacids like Maalox and Tums, and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.

upsides_processed.orig: Most people can take Cimetidine without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Cimetidine lasts longer than many other antacids like Maalox and Tums, and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.

drugs.name: Tagamet

off-label_indications.indication: Clear cell carcinoma of the kidney

carousel_items_processed.orig: Works best if you take it with a full glass of water.
Starts working in one hour.
If heartburn doesn't improve or lasts more than 2 weeks, talk to your doctor.
People with kidney disease may need to take a lower dose.
Tell your doctor all of the medications that you use before taking Cimetidine to avoid drug interactions.

risks_warnings.title: Hiding possible cancer
risks_warnings.description: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Cimetidine for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Cimetidine for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Confusion
risks_warnings.description: Cimetidine can cause states of intense confusion. This is usually reversible when you stop taking Cimetidine. If you have kidney problems, you may need a different dose to prevent this increased risk for side effects.  However, stopping Cimetidine completely may be necessary.

description_processed.orig: Cimetidine can cause states of intense confusion. This is usually reversible when you stop taking Cimetidine. If you have kidney problems, you may need a different dose to prevent this increased risk for side effects.  However, stopping Cimetidine completely may be necessary.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: Cimetidine can cause an allergic reaction.  The reaction might cause swelling of the throat, face, lips or tongue, difficulty breathing, or rash. If this happens to you stop taking Cimetidine and get medical help right away. Do not take Cimetidine if you have ever had an allergic reaction to similar medications like zantac or tagamet.

description_processed.orig: Cimetidine can cause an allergic reaction.  The reaction might cause swelling of the throat, face, lips or tongue, difficulty breathing, or rash. If this happens to you stop taking Cimetidine and get medical help right away. Do not take Cimetidine if you have ever had an allergic reaction to similar medications like zantac or tagamet.

risks_warnings.title: Infection
risks_warnings.description: Although rare, people with a weakened immune system are at increased risk for a roundworm infection (strongyloidiasis) while using Cimetidine.

description_processed.orig: Although rare, people with a weakened immune system are at increased risk for a roundworm infection (strongyloidiasis) while using Cimetidine.

carousel_items: Works best if you take it with a full glass of water.
Starts working in one hour.
If heartburn doesn't improve or lasts more than 2 weeks, talk to your doctor.
People with kidney disease may need to take a lower dose.

basics.benefits_moa: Zantac is an H2 blocker. It blocks the chemical histamine, which lowers acid production in your stomach. This treats heartburn and helps ulcers heal.
basics.bottom_line: Zantac works well for heartburn but may not last as long or start working as quickly as other antacids.
downsides: Other antacids like Maalox, Tums, or Rolaids often start to work more quickly than Ranitidine.
Medication like omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) works better at healing and preventing stomach ulcers than medication like Ranitidine (H2 blockers).

downsides_processed.orig: Other antacids like Maalox, Tums, or Rolaids often start to work more quickly than Ranitidine.
Medication like omeprazole (proton pump inhibitors) works better at healing and preventing stomach ulcers than medication like Ranitidine (H2 blockers).

upsides: Most people can take Ranitidine without any noticeable day-to-day side effects.
Ranitidine lasts longer than many other antacids like Maalox and Tums, and you only need to take it once or twice a day.
You can take it in combination with a quick-acting antacid (like Maalox or Tums) if you need relief right away.
Available as both a generic and over-the-counter option, so it's pretty affordable.
Few drug interactions.

userStories.tip: some times i have seen that some physicians used to prescribe renitidine as a co-medicine since it is not of use, & a wast majority of people uses this drug as a medication for Indigestion, Vomiting, etc

I take 300mg daily divided into 2 doses. I have a hiatus hernia and have been taking this medication for most of the last 30 years. I am allergic to any others and would not be without this medication.

drugs.name: Zantac

carousel_items_processed.orig: Works best if you take it with a full glass of water.
Starts working in one hour.
If heartburn doesn't improve or lasts more than 2 weeks, talk to your doctor.
People with kidney disease may need to take a lower dose.

risks_warnings.title: Hiding possible cancer
risks_warnings.description: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Zantac for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

description_processed.orig: Heartburn and feelings of upset stomach can be warning signs of a more serious stomach problem or cancer. If you need to take Zantac for 2 weeks or more go see a doctor. It's safest to get checked out to make sure you do not have a serious stomach condition.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: Zantac is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent this increased risk for side effects.

description_processed.orig: Zantac is processed by the kidney and liver. If you have kidney or liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent this increased risk for side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Attacks of acute porphyria
risks_warnings.description: Zantac can cause attacks of blood disease called acute porphyria.  Don't use Zantac if you have acute porphyria.

description_processed.orig: Zantac can cause attacks of blood disease called acute porphyria.  Don't use Zantac if you have acute porphyria.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: People with sensitivity to phenylketones and phenylalanine should NOT take Zantac "EFFERdose" tablets. This dosage form contains phenylalanine as an ingredient. The other dosage forms of Zantac do not contain phenylalanine.

description_processed.orig: People with sensitivity to phenylketones and phenylalanine should NOT take Zantac "EFFERdose" tablets. This dosage form contains phenylalanine as an ingredient. The other dosage forms of Zantac do not contain phenylalanine.
